channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @strawburriez Who is giving these pharmacists this guidance? The drug manufacturer? The pharmacy chain? The state? Some Christian extremist group? A pharmacist’s organization or FB group?
@DemocraticLuntz @EladNehorai @AviMayer @benwaxman I think courts invalidated them prior to the Civil Rights acts.

@DemocraticLuntz @EladNehorai @AviMayer @benwaxman That’s a really interesting question, and a reminder to schedule an interview with a local amateur scholar of such covenants.
@DemocraticLuntz @EladNehorai @AviMayer @benwaxman The fun thing is that since all 20th century liberal precedents are no longer binding, they can all bounce back once a town clerk refuses to register a title transfer that violates the covenant.
@ZachWeiner “To the moon, Alice!”
@SFRuminations https://t.co/bnuL9Rrwbv
Relevant to the article in the Post yesterday about news avoidance. https://t.co/xYrus7jzq2
@JewishWonk @GershomG And שיר המעלות to “I”m a Believer”
@shlumpsters 25 years older than my great grandmother — whose 100th birthday party I attended when I was 13.
Love me some late night Hebrew. https://t.co/dU9TK5pE3Q
Future Media Short Story Review: Theodore Sturgeon’s “And Now the News…” (1956) | Science Fiction and Other Suspect Ruminations https://t.co/MzwHXGadZL
@AD_Lobel Sounds like dark matter erasure, but okay.
@datadivajf Last year I was running too late to publish it. I need to decide in the next couple weeks.
@datadivajf Hmmmmm…..

Organization led by coup instigator’s lawyer condemns legitimately elected American president. https://t.co/QgFgjscX6q
#NotAllZionists #MayISpeakToTheZionistBrandManager
@AkivaMCohen If he were to start honoring the subpoena at this point, will that help him at the trial?
@kampeas Worth noting that J Tucker describes himself as a “Chief Liberty Officer.” Seems to be saying the quiet part of “libertarianism” pretty loudly here.
@DBashIdeas @OnSophiaStreet eBay may have replacement parts, once you’ve become an expert in that particular type of keyboard.
@DBashIdeas Broken or detached? Google and YouTube are likely your friends here.
@9_tellthetruth @joshtpm This says he is a “Chief Liberty Officer.” Who is apparently offended by mentions of people kept without liberty. Weird.
@cstross John Barnes wrote a fun trifle on the American version of this phenomenon in 2012: Raise the Gipper! https://t.co/IuiLnCgV6K

@froomkin might argue that the bothsider instinct of the news denies both the subjects of the stories and their readers of agency — one of the problems noted in the quoted piece. https://t.co/aSsNzp7WH9
Note that the mantra of “vote” effectively denies agency to those of us who always vote. Whereas “make sure all your friends vote” or “here are ways to convince your Republican relatives to sit out the midterms” provide agency — and aren’t on the Democrat’s agenda.
@jaymichaelson The specific view she was punished for was outrage that a DC comic book character was bisexual.
Classified document reveals IDF ‘firing zones’ built to give land to settlers https://t.co/4Mh1VuaS09
@BritishTim @dzkalman She knows her audience.
